page.title: 15HALFWAY EGG FARM
page.content:
Halfway egg farm has got 8000 chickens. There are four to a cage. The eggs fall down into a trough. The eggs are collected twice daily, at 0830 and 1500. 5844 eggs were collected on Sunday, the 30th June, 1985. Each day the chickens get through a ton of food. They eat a mixture of wheat, maize, soya bean, barley, protein and grit. Grit hardens the shell on the egg. The hens' lifespan is 14 months. Then they are slaughtered and sold to the supermarkets. They cannot be roasted because they are not tender enough, so they have to be boiled. Halfway egg farm is next to the Sheppey Court retirement home.
Stephen Carr.
